name: Hotel Aranea

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I enjoyed our 3 night stay at Apsis Aranea. The hotel is modern and functional. The room was cleaned and towels changed everyday. Break fast was included and had something for all tastes(we are vegetarians and this was not a problem) Many reviews complain about the bed and the TV, but we didnt find this a problem. The bed was fine and as far as the TV is concerned, we only we there to sleep and not watch TV, which I expect is what most people will go to Barcelona for! The hotel is about 15 to 20 minutes walk to Placa Catalunya. La Sagrada familia is only a short 10 minute walk from the hotel. There are a few cafes and shops around the hotel. The area felt safe at all times of the day. Barcelona is built for pedestrians, we were impressed by the pavements in Barcelona which were in most cases wider than the roads!! Tetuan metro station is only 5 minutes from the hotel. The metro system in Barcelona is very cheap and convenient, but we walked to most places, which is the best way to see Barcelona and all its amazing buildings. Occasionally we took the metro in the evenings when we were tired. We bought a T-10 card which was sufficient for our entire 4 day stay: one T-10 card can be shared between any number of people.
reviews.title: Nice clean modern hotel

likes.disliked: — Will have to ask for a double bed else wil be given a twin!

reviews.text: Be very wary of taking taxis from the Airport, they sometimes try to rip you off. Our taxi driver tried to charge us 38 euros even though the meter only indicated 21 euros (he types 38 into the keypad!!). I'd suggest if this happens, get out and ask the hotel staff to help you, especially if you do not speak much spanish! One the way back to Barcelona airport we took the metro to Sants Estacia station and took the RENFEE train to 'Aeroport' which takes 20 mins from Sants.
reviews.title: Comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I did a bit of research about top places to visit and veggie restaurants. If anyone wants the list, send me a message and will email it to you. Enjoy Barcelona! We did!!
reviews.title: Excellent Boutique Hotel!!

likes.disliked: — Tv didn't work...but our own fault as they offered to change rooms - but we couldn't be bothered as already settled

reviews.text: Hotel was very clean and the rooms reasonably appointed. Reception staff were extremely helpful and helped us with quetions & problems we had.
reviews.title: Cheap, Clean and not much more!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location was OK, but not as described on the Hotel website. The bus station was about 20 minutes walk & the nearest metro was Monumental about 10 mins away.
reviews.title: Brilliant Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked to stop at Hotel Apsis Aranea for 4 nights after reading the reviews on this website and weren't disappointed. We arrived late in the evening (about 11.30) after flying from Liverpool. As we flew with Ryanir, the airport was a good 1 hour bus journey away, however the bus station is only 6 blocks walk from the hotel. Although it was dark and quiet, we felt very safe walking 10-15 mins. Definitely no need for a taxi.
reviews.title: Great Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we walked through the doors, the night porter greeted us by name, knowing that we were checking in late (I had emailed ahead) and were probably also the last to check in. However I thought it was a lovely touch and made us feel very welcome after a tiring journey.
reviews.title: Good hotel for the money, location is decent
A good hotel in a good location at a good price
reviews.text: We had a room overlooking the front street and the intersection. Although it was quite busy during the day, noise wasn't a problem and was very quiet at night. The decor was lovely - very minimal, white cotton sheets and not a disgusting multi-coloured bed throw in sight! The room was quite small, but we already knew and it wasn't a problem for the two of us.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Easy walking distance to Sagrada Familia and the Ramblas - although if you are tired of walking there is a metro nearby. We found it great being a short way out of the main tourist area just simply for the quiet. Plus there are lots of fantastic buildings to admire as you are walking.
reviews.title: Exceptional Hotel!

reviews.text: Great location, great service. No faults.
reviews.title: Loved it!

likes.disliked: — not great computer area (only one internet computer)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed there in June. The desk staff were very accommodating. Spoke English well. Very clean room, altho' somewhat small but with a large well-equipped bath. The location was a short walk to the Sagrada Familia but not near anything else. Excellent value.
reviews.title: clean and helpful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 5 nights at the Apsis Aranea and the location of this hotel is superb. It is two blocks from the Sagrada Famillia, 15mins walk from the Arc de Triumf and Girona metro station close by. When we arrived all the double rooms were booked up and we had to take a twin room as an alternative. The staff was very friendly and helpful in making sure we got a double room the next day. The twin room had a far bigger bathroom than the double room. Overall this hotel was very convenient and situated in a good part of Barcelona. Enjoy.
reviews.title: Does the job

reviews.text: The hotel is located in a quiet neighborhood and has vey nice modern rooms and bath. Short walk to Batllo and Sagrada Familia. Short cab ride to Pl. Catalyuna. Very friendly hotel staff. Free Internet in lobby. Free safe in room. Did not have breakfast.
reviews.title: Very nice and Friendly hotel

reviews.text: I stayed in a single room 402 for 4 nights and paid Euro 80 + VAT per night. I would stay here again.
reviews.title: Would definitely stay here again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We read the reviews of this hotel and were not disappointed. The hotel was spotlessly clean, staff was extremely courteous and friendly and we found the location to be good. Easy walk to Sagrada Familia, buses and the metro. The hotel is located in a residential area. We felt extremely safe at all hours. Even late at night when we stepped out to use the pay phone to make international phone calls. Free internet access in the business center. The only drawback is the hardness of the bed and not much closet/drawer space. I would definitely stay again and heartily recommend Apsis Aranea if you are looking for a safe, friendly, clean, affordable hotel.
reviews.title: good location for sightseeing in barca

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Me and my wife stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. As suggested by other reviewers we requested the top floor to minimize the street noise. We end up staying in room 701 (top floor right across from elevators). It turned out that both elevators had some sort of switch/relay box right next to the doors and at night they kept switching on and off and the switching noise can be heard from the room. So if you're a light sleeper, do not stay on the 7th floor. The room was actually descent size and a very nice and clean bathroom. The breakfast was OK, nothing special. Some cold cuts, coffee, juices. When something runs out, girls that wait the counter took their time with refilling it. Location is about 25 minute walk from the center. We end up buying metro card (10 rides for 7 euros) and took subway back to the hotel which stops 4 small blocks from the hotel (5 minute walk). There's a supermarket few doors down where we shopped for water, wine and snacks (good prices). Overall, descent room, OK breakfast, good deal.
reviews.title: Good Stay in Barcelona
Clean friendly hotel
reviews.text: Myself and my boyfriend stayed here for 3 nights in september 2006. I am a real clean freak and worry that hotels will not be up to my standard - however, this hotel did not let me down. Spotlessly clean with nice laminate floors and white bed linen. The hotel is not for those who want something bang in the middle of La Rambas, but it is only 7mins or so from La Sagrada Familia and the tube isn't much of a walk either. We didn't have breakfast in the hotel, instead we found a lovely, clean and cheap cafe near by. All in all, perfect short break in barcelona, clean and comfortable hotel in quiet area.

reviews.title: Recommended
reviews.text: We stayed here for 8 nights from September 3. Three of us had adjoining rooms on the 7th floor. The rooms were a bit small but the bathroom was large in comparison, There are wooden floors which are bit noisey but this is compensated by being in a quiet part of town, and the house maids are very efficient. The reception staff are very helpful and speak very good English. We used taxis quite a bit as we found them quite cheap. One tip though, if you have suitcases, make sure you load them in and out of the taxi otherwise the over eager drivers charge 6 Euro a case for loading them for you. We found the breakfasts too dear at 11 Euro a head, but for 8 Euros I bought a weeks supply of breakfasts from a supermarket 2 blocks away and ate in our rooms. The rooms had a reasonable good size safe in the closet. I was relieved of my wallet and contents the first day on Las Ramblas but unbelieveably retrieved it back within seconds fully in tact I suspect the timely arrival of two police officers on the beat just at that time assisted in the abandonment of the crime. What was a problem was we don't speak Spanish. We were advised that this would not be a problem as almost everybody there speaks English - Wrong - Very few people either don't speak English or can't be bothered if you can't speak Spanish and we found those people openly rude to us. Most taxi drivers are in this category. I would definately stay here again. The free internet in the lobby was a bonus, We also recommend that you try eating down at the Olympic Villiage at Barcelonetta There are some great deal, like 5 courses for 17 Euros, avoid eating on or near Las Ramblas as they rip you off.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently stayed at the Apsis Aranea for 9 nights. The hotel staff was great and the hotel itself was very clean. The value was great as I booked well in advance on the hotel website. The breakfast was convenient with a good choice of items, although a bit expensive considering you could go to a local bakery or supermarket for much less. There was a safe and minibar in the room...the safe is needed to store cash and credit cards so you're not walking around with excess. There was also wireless internet access in the room if you choose to bring your laptop. The only complaint, the TV didn't work...not even one channel. We're in a bad habit of sleeping with it on. Even though this location isn't close, we didn't mind. There is a Metro station very close and the Metro is very easy to navigate. You could also walk, and we did at times, although it was a 20-30 min walk to Las Rambles.
reviews.title: Good Home Base

reviews.text: Stayed here with friends when at the U2 gig in Camp Nou. Hotel location was great as it 5 minutes from the Sagrada Familia and 10 minutes from Place de la catalunia (spelling!)
reviews.title: Great Location

likes.disliked: — Breakfast could be extended by half an hour

description: Small and cozy hotel located right in the middle of Eixample, just a short walk away from Sagrada Familia and Passeig de Gracia. The perfect place if you are visiting Barcelona for pleasure or business The Hotel Aranea have a nice restaurant specialized in Mediterranean cuisine, a business centre with internet connection, two meeting room up to 25 persons each one, TV room and solarium terrace on the top of the building. Parking on requestThe 84 light rooms are equipped with air conditioning, full bathroom with hairdryer, TV with international channels, safe deposit box, minibar, exterior telephone line and wire less internet connection. The meeting rooms “Girona” and “Ático”, are totally sound proofed. They both have natural light, audiovisual equipment and high speed internet connection. They are the perfect place for your business meetings.
